TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit MimeMessage extends System.Object

Docs.summary: A MIME message.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. An array of initialization parameters: headers and message parts.

exception.para: contains one or more arguments of an unknown type.

Docs.summary: Gets the attachments.
Docs.value: The attachments.
Docs.remarks: Traverses over the MIME tree, enumerating all of the objects that have a Content-Disposition header set to "attachment".

Docs.summary: Gets the list of addresses in the Bcc header.
Docs.value: The list of addresses in the Bcc header.
Docs.remarks: Recipients in the Blind-Carpbon-Copy list will not be visible to the other recipients of the message.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the body of the message.
Docs.value: The body of the message.

Docs.summary: Gets the body parts of the message.
Docs.value: The body parts.
Docs.remarks: Traverses over the MIME tree, enumerating all of the objects.

Docs.summary: Gets the list of addresses in the Cc header.
Docs.value: The list of addresses in the Cc header.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the date of the message.
Docs.value: The date of the message.
Docs.remarks: If the date is not explicitly set before the message is written to a stream, the date will default to the exact moment when it is written to said stream.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Encrypt(class MimeKit.Cryptography.CryptographyContext ctx) cil managed

Docs.summary: Encrypt the message to the sender and all of the recipients using the specified cryptography context.
Docs.remarks: If either of the Resent-Sender or Resent-From headers are set, then the message will be encrypted to all of the addresses specified in the Resent headers (Resent-Sender, Resent-From, Resent-To, Resent-Cc, and Resent-Bcc), otherwise the message will be encrypted to all of the addresses specified in the standard address headers (Sender, From, To, Cc, and Bcc).
Docs.exception: is null.
An unknown type of cryptography context was used.
A certificate could not be found for one or more of the recipients.
The public key could not be found for one or more of the recipients.

Docs.summary: Gets the list of addresses in the From header.
Docs.value: The list of addresses in the From header.

Docs.summary: Gets the list of headers.
Docs.value: The list of headers.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the message-id that this message is in reply to.
Docs.value: The message id that this message is in reply to.
Docs.exception: is improperly formatted.

Docs.summary: Explicit cast to convert a to a .

remarks.para: Casting a to a makes it possible to use MimeKit with .
It should be noted, however, that cannot represent all MIME structures that can be constructed using MimeKit, so the conversion may not be perfect.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Sign(class MimeKit.Cryptography.CryptographyContext ctx) cil managed

Docs.summary: Sign the message using the specified cryptography context and the SHA-1 digest algorithm.
Docs.remarks: If either of the Resent-Sender or Resent-From headers are set, then the message will be signed using the Resent-Sender (or first mailbox in the Resent-From) address as the signer address, otherwise the Sender or From address will be used instead.
Docs.exception: is null.

exception.para: A sender has not been specified.

Docs.exception: A signing certificate could not be found for the sender.
The private key could not be found for the sender.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Sign (MimeKit.Cryptography.CryptographyContext ctx, MimeKit.Cryptography.DigestAlgorithm digestAlgo);
.method public hidebysig instance void Sign(class MimeKit.Cryptography.CryptographyContext ctx, valuetype MimeKit.Cryptography.DigestAlgorithm digestAlgo) cil managed

Docs.summary: Sign the message using the specified cryptography context and digest algorithm.
Docs.remarks: If either of the Resent-Sender or Resent-From headers are set, then the message will be signed using the Resent-Sender (or first mailbox in the Resent-From) address as the signer address, otherwise the Sender or From address will be used instead.
Docs.exception: is null.

exception.para: A sender has not been specified.

Docs.exception: The was out of range.
The is not supported.
A signing certificate could not be found for the sender.
The private key could not be found for the sender.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void SignAndEncrypt(class MimeKit.Cryptography.CryptographyContext ctx) cil managed

Docs.summary: Sign and encrypt the message to the sender and all of the recipients using the specified cryptography context and the SHA-1 digest algorithm.

remarks.para: If either of the Resent-Sender or Resent-From headers are set, then the message will be signed using the Resent-Sender (or first mailbox in the Resent-From) address as the signer address, otherwise the Sender or From address will be used instead.

Likewise, if either of the Resent-Sender or Resent-From headers are set, then the message will be encrypted to all of the addresses specified in the Resent headers (Resent-Sender, Resent-From, Resent-To, Resent-Cc, and Resent-Bcc), otherwise the message will be encrypted to all of the addresses specified in the standard address headers (Sender, From, To, Cc, and Bcc).

Docs.exception: is null.
An unknown type of cryptography context was used.
A certificate could not be found for the signer or one or more of the recipients.
The private key could not be found for the sender.
The public key could not be found for one or more of the recipients.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SignAndEncrypt (MimeKit.Cryptography.CryptographyContext ctx, MimeKit.Cryptography.DigestAlgorithm digestAlgo);
.method public hidebysig instance void SignAndEncrypt(class MimeKit.Cryptography.CryptographyContext ctx, valuetype MimeKit.Cryptography.DigestAlgorithm digestAlgo) cil managed

Docs.summary: Sign and encrypt the message to the sender and all of the recipients using the specified cryptography context and the specified digest algorithm.

remarks.para: If either of the Resent-Sender or Resent-From headers are set, then the message will be signed using the Resent-Sender (or first mailbox in the Resent-From) address as the signer address, otherwise the Sender or From address will be used instead.

Likewise, if either of the Resent-Sender or Resent-From headers are set, then the message will be encrypted to all of the addresses specified in the Resent headers (Resent-Sender, Resent-From, Resent-To, Resent-Cc, and Resent-Bcc), otherwise the message will be encrypted to all of the addresses specified in the standard address headers (Sender, From, To, Cc, and Bcc).

Docs.exception: is null.
An unknown type of cryptography context was used.
The was out of range.
The is not supported.
A certificate could not be found for the signer or one or more of the recipients.
The private key could not be found for the sender.
The public key could not be found for one or more of the recipients.

Docs.value: The subject of the message.
Docs.exception: is null.

Docs.summary: Gets the list of addresses in the To header.
Docs.value: The list of addresses in the To header.
